            ;(async () => {
              const waitForCello = () => new Promise(resolve => {
                const check = () => {
                  if (window.CelloAttribution) return resolve(true)
                  setTimeout(check, 50)
                }
                check()
              })
              await waitForCello()
              try {
                const refName = await window.CelloAttribution('getReferrerName')
                window.CelloData = Object.assign({}, window.CelloData, { referrerName: refName })
              } catch (e) {
                console.error('Cello attribution failed', e)
              }
            })()
          </script>

Whatagraph</h2><figure class="media"><div data-oembed-url="https://youtu.be/jPBSI3My-5s"><div style="position: relative; padding-bottom: 100%; height: 0; padding-bottom: 56.2493%;"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jPBSI3My-5s" style="position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; top: 0; left: 0;" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></div></div></figure><p> </p><p><a href="https://whatagraph.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Whatagraph</a> is an all-in-one marketing data platform which makes it ridiculously easy to collect, analyze, and report on your datawhether thats PPC, social media, website performance, or more.</p><p>Unlike other tools like <a href="/blog/articles/how-to-know-you-have-outgrown-looker-studio"  rel="noopener noreferrer">Looker Studio</a> or Tableau, you can <strong>get Whatagraph up and running in a few hours</strong> (not days or weeks).</p><p>You also dont need to hire a data scientist or spend thousands of dollars on an implementation partner. </p><p>Anyone on your teamwhether thats an Account Manager or a data analystcan start analyzing data and building reports right away. </p><p>In a nutshell, heres how Whatagraph works:</p><ol><li><strong>Connect</strong> to your data sources and channels in a few clicks. Your data will flow in automatically.</li><li><strong>Organize</strong> your data, teams, and clients on one platform. Make custom metrics and dimensions, and blend data sources together.</li><li><strong>Visualize</strong> your data using drag-and-drop widgets or <a href="/templates"  rel="noopener noreferrer">ready-made templates</a>. Create <a href="/blog/articles/white-label-marketing-tools"  rel="noopener noreferrer">white-labeled reports</a> with custom logos, domains, and color schemes. </li><li><strong>Share</strong> reports as live links, PDFs, Excel spreadsheets, or automated emails.</li></ol><p><img src="https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png" srcset="https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=350 350w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=700 700w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=420 440w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=840 880w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=768 768w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=1536 1536w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=992 992w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=1984 1984w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=600 1200w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=1200 2400w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=720 1440w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Marketing_Analytics_Report_75c561dade.png?width=1440 2880w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 350px, (max-width: 440px) 440px, (max-width: 768px) 768px, (max-width: 992px) 992px, (max-width: 1200px) 1200px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 350px) 700px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 420px) 840px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 768px) 1536px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 992px) 1984px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 1200px) 2400px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) 2880px, 1440px" loading="lazy" fetchpriority="auto" decoding="async" alt="Marketing analytics report template - </li><li>Non-existent customer support</li><li>Steep learning curve</li></ul><p><strong>An easier way to extract insight from GA4</strong></p><p>A serious disadvantage of Google Analytics 4 is the There are seven Exploration Report templates, but theres no way to change the information. </p><p>And if you create new reports from scratch, you face another set of challenges:</p><ul><li>First, you need to standardize and consolidate data across different data streams and dimensions to ensure the data is consistent and accurate.</li><li>Then, you need to have a clear understanding of the clients business KPIs to ensure the data is presented in a relevant order that helps decision-making.</li><li>Finally, you must configure all the dimensions, metrics, and segment details <i>before</i> the visualization appears, which can lead to a painstaking trial-and-error session. This is especially true since you cant save any visualization you create along the way as a template. </li></ul><p>Whatagraph offers a much more intuitive, faster, and flexible GA4 reporting method. The platform integrates with over 100 data sources and destinations, including Tableau, Power BI, Excel, Looker Studio, Snowflake, BigQuery, and many others. </p><p>On the other hand, Supermetrics provides only basic data transformation features. Marketing teams who use this digital analytics tool need IT expertise or data analysts to execute data mapping and transformation. </p><p>Another characteristic of Supermetrics is that it lacks native visualization. However, there is a library of pre-built marketing analytics templates designed for popular platforms such as Looker Studio or Google Sheets. </p><p>The templates are created for specific marketing reporting needs such as SEO monitoring, PPC campaign analysis, social media performance, etc.  </p><p><strong>Key features:</strong></p><ul><li>Event tracking</li><li>Real-time and retroactive reporting</li><li>User, role, and access management</li><li>Data collection</li><li>Multichannel tracking </li></ul><p><strong>Who is Supermetrics for?</strong></p><p>Supermetrics is a marketing tracking tool for small businesses or marketing teams with basic analytics needs and a low-to-moderate number of data sources.</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>Simple and easy to use </li><li>Automated no-code data transfers</li><li>Easy retrieval of historical data</li><li>Great for extracting data to BI or ML platforms </li></ul><p><strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Loading data to multiple destinations is not available with a single pricing plan</li><li>Adding more data sources requires buying more connectors</li><li><a href="/blog/articles/looker-studio-slow">Looker Studio connector can get slow</a> when connected to multiple ad accounts</li></ul><p><strong>Pricing</strong></p><p>Supermetrics offers pricing plans based on the final destination and the number of data sources you want to connect. However, for most plans, you need to contact their sales department to get quotes. To obtain specific pricing, you need to contact Adobes sales team for a tailored quote based on your unique requirements and usage scenarios.</p><h2 id="matomo">13. Matomo</h2><figure class="image"><img src="https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png" srcset="https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=350 350w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=700 700w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=420 440w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=840 880w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=768 768w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=1536 1536w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=992 992w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=1984 1984w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=600 1200w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=1200 2400w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=720 1440w, https://media.whatagraph.com/Matomo_5577699815.png?width=1440 2880w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 350px, (max-width: 440px) 440px, (max-width: 768px) 768px, (max-width: 992px) 992px, (max-width: 1200px) 1200px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 350px) 700px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 420px) 840px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 768px) 1536px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 992px) 1984px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) and (max-width: 1200px) 2400px, (min-resolution: 192dpi) 2880px, 1440px" loading="lazy" fetchpriority="auto" decoding="async" alt="Matomo report"></figure><p><a href="/integrations/matomo">Matomo</a> is an open-source web analytics platform that provides detailed insights into website and mobile app performance. It is designed to offer comprehensive analytics while prioritizing user privacy and data ownership. Formerly known as Piwik, this digital analytics platform enables businesses to track and analyze user behavior, measure key performance indicators (KPIs), and optimize their digital presence.<br> </p><p><strong>Key features:</strong></p><ul><li>Comprehensive website analytics</li><li>Privacy and data ownership</li><li>GDPR compliance</li><li>Self-hosted option</li><li>E-commerce conversion tracking</li><li>Mobile tracking</li></ul><p><strong>Who is Matomo for?</strong></p><p>Matomo is ideal for large enterprises that prioritize data privacy and need advanced customization and extensibility.</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>Highly customizable with numerous plugins</li><li>Full control over data and compliance with privacy regulations</li><li>Flexible and transparent open-source platform </li><li>Both free and competitively priced version</li></ul><p><strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Self-hosting requires technical expertise to set up and maintain</li><li>UI is less polished compared to other analytics tools</li><li>Steep learning curve</li><li>Self-hosted versions may take up significant server resources</li></ul><p><strong>Pricing</strong></p><p>Matomo has two pricing plans: On-Premise and Cloud. The Cloud plan depends on your monthly website traffic expressed as hits, while the On-Premise is initially free but includes paid add-on functionalities. </p><h2 id="faqs">FAQs</h2><h3 id="what-is-a-marketing-analytics-tool">What is a marketing analytics tool?</h3><p>Marketing analytics tools provide a wide range of functions, from tracking website traffic and social media engagement to analyzing customer behavior and predicting sales trends. They allow marketers to dive deeper into the data and identify patterns, customer segments, and opportunities for optimization. On the client or stakeholder side, marketing analytics tools can influence data-driven decisions. </p><h3 id="what-is-marketing-analytics-software-used-for">What is marketing analytics software used for?</h3><p>Marketing analytics software helps marketers get a full overview of their marketing performance. With analytics tools and software, they can track the results across all campaigns, monitor the number of leads generated by each channel, calculate metrics, report to clients or stakeholders, and more.</p><h3 id="what-is-the-future-of-marketing-analytics">What is the future of marketing analytics?</h3><p>In the future, marketing analytics will increasingly rely on artificial intelligence and use machine learning models for forecasting. Generative AI for marketing is becoming increasingly significant, offering capabilities like automated content generation and predictive analytics. The critical ability of generative AI in marketing analytics is to turn data into instant insights, which foster decision-making and help businesses optimize their marketing activities.</p></div></div><!----></div><section><div class="mb-8 flex justify-between border-b border-grey-300 pb-9"><p class="wg-small-span text-grey"> Published on May 29 2024</p><div class="mb-8 metadata.title: 13 Best Marketing Analytics Tools Loved By Marketers in 2025 | Whatagraph
metadata.description: We reviewed 13 best marketing analytics tools that are highly customizable, easy to use and set up, and come with great customer support.

reasoning: The website clearly presents a 'best of' list reviewing and comparing multiple marketing analytics tools. The title and content explicitly state it is a review of '13 Best Marketing Analytics Tools' and mentions numerous competing products such as Google Analytics 4, Semrush, Hubspot, and others. The site itself, Whatagraph, is listed as one of the tools being reviewed, reinforcing its position as a third-party content platform rather than the official site for one of the listed products.
